index.name: index
index.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_index (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "title" VARCHAR, "about" TEXT, "blog" TEXT, "body" TEXT, "description" VARCHAR, "experience" TEXT, "extension" VARCHAR, "faq" TEXT, "hero" TEXT, "meta" TEXT, "navigation" TEXT DEFAULT true, "path" VARCHAR, "seo" TEXT DEFAULT '{}', "stem" VARCHAR, "testimonials" TEXT, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

projects.name: projects
projects.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_projects (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "title" VARCHAR, "date" TEXT, "description" VARCHAR, "extension" VARCHAR, "image" VARCHAR, "meta" TEXT, "stem" VARCHAR, "tags" TEXT, "url" VARCHAR, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

blog.name: blog
blog.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_blog (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "title" VARCHAR, "author" TEXT, "body" TEXT, "date" TEXT, "description" VARCHAR, "extension" VARCHAR, "image" VARCHAR, "meta" TEXT, "minRead" INT, "navigation" TEXT DEFAULT true, "path" VARCHAR, "seo" TEXT DEFAULT '{}', "stem" VARCHAR, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

pages.name: pages
pages.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_pages (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "title" VARCHAR, "body" TEXT, "description" VARCHAR, "extension" VARCHAR, "links" TEXT, "meta" TEXT, "navigation" TEXT DEFAULT true, "path" VARCHAR, "seo" TEXT DEFAULT '{}', "stem" VARCHAR, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

speaking.name: speaking
speaking.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_speaking (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "title" VARCHAR, "body" TEXT, "description" VARCHAR, "events" TEXT, "extension" VARCHAR, "links" TEXT, "meta" TEXT, "navigation" TEXT DEFAULT true, "path" VARCHAR, "seo" TEXT DEFAULT '{}', "stem" VARCHAR, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

services.name: services
services.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_services (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "title" VARCHAR, "body" TEXT, "cta" TEXT NULL, "description" VARCHAR, "extension" VARCHAR, "links" TEXT, "meta" TEXT, "navigation" TEXT DEFAULT true, "offerings" TEXT, "packages" TEXT NULL, "path" VARCHAR, "process" TEXT, "seo" TEXT DEFAULT '{}', "stem" VARCHAR, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

about.name: about
about.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_about (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "title" VARCHAR, "body" TEXT, "content" TEXT, "description" VARCHAR, "extension" VARCHAR, "images" TEXT, "meta" TEXT, "navigation" TEXT DEFAULT true, "path" VARCHAR, "seo" TEXT DEFAULT '{}', "stem" VARCHAR, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

info.name: info
info.tableDefinition: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS _content_info (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, "ready" BOOLEAN, "structureVersion" VARCHAR, "version" VARCHAR, "__hash__" TEXT UNIQUE);

attrs.title: Default Attributes
attrs.description:
Attributes applied to every icon component.

@default { "aria-hidden": true }

mode.title: Default Rendering Mode
mode.description: Set the default rendering mode for the icon component

aliases.title: Icon aliases
aliases.description: Define Icon aliases to update them easily without code changes.

cssSelectorPrefix.title: CSS Selector Prefix
cssSelectorPrefix.description: Set the default CSS selector prefix.

cssWherePseudo.title: Use CSS `:where()` Pseudo Selector
cssWherePseudo.description: Use CSS `:where()` pseudo selector to reduce specificity.

collections.title: Icon Collections
collections.description:
List of known icon collections name. Used to resolve collection name ambiguity.
e.g. `simple-icons-github` -> `simple-icons:github` instead of `simple:icons-github`

When not provided, will use the full Iconify collection list.

provider.title: Icon Provider
provider.description:
Provider to use for fetching icons

- `server` - Fetch icons with a server handler
- `iconify` - Fetch icons with Iconify API, purely client-side
- `none` - Do not fetch icons (use client bundle only)

`server` by default; `iconify` when `ssr: false`

iconifyApiEndpoint.title: Iconify API Endpoint URL
iconifyApiEndpoint.description: Define a custom Iconify API endpoint URL. Useful if you want to use a self-hosted Iconify API. Learn more: https://iconify.design/docs/api.

fallbackToApi.title: Fallback to Iconify API
fallbackToApi.description: Fallback to Iconify API if server provider fails to found the collection.

localApiEndpoint.title: Local API Endpoint Path
localApiEndpoint.description: Define a custom path for the local API endpoint.

fetchTimeout.title: Fetch Timeout
fetchTimeout.description: Set the timeout for fetching icons.

customize.title: Customize callback
customize.description: Customize icon content (replace stroke-width, colors, etc...).

dark.title: Dark mode
dark.description: Your profile picture in dark mode.

light.title: Light mode
light.description: Your profile picture in light mode.

colors.title: Colors
colors.description: Manage main colors of your application

icons.title: Icons
icons.description: Manage icons used in the application.

search.title: Search Bar
search.description: Icon to display in the search bar.

dark.title: Dark mode
dark.description: Icon of color mode button for dark mode.

light.title: Light mode
light.description: Icon of color mode button for light mode.

siteName.title: Site Name
siteName.description: Name used in ogSiteName and used as second part of your page title (My page title - Nuxt UI Pro).

credits.title: Footer credits section
credits.description: Text to display as credits in the footer.

links.title: Links
links.description: Array of link object displayed in footer.

slots.title: mx-auto max-w-xl text-pretty text-3xl sm:text-4xl lg:text-5xl
slots.description: mt-2 text-md mx-auto max-w-2xl text-pretty sm:text-md text-muted

path.name: path
path.description: A relative path to the current location. This property should be removed

replace.name: replace
replace.description: Replace the entry in the history instead of pushing a new entry

force.name: force
force.description:
Triggers the navigation even if the location is the same as the current one.
Note this will also add a new entry to the history unless `replace: true`
is passed.

state.name: state
state.description:
State to save using the History API. This cannot contain any reactive
values and some primitives like Symbols are forbidden. More info at
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/History/state

mods.name: mods
mods.description: Contains the original modules for lazy loaded components.

components.name: components
components.description: Components to display when the URL matches this route. Allow using named views.

redirect.name: redirect
redirect.description:
Where to redirect if the route is directly matched. The redirection happens
before any navigation guard and triggers a new navigation with the new
target location.

props.name: props
props.description:
Allow passing down params as props to the component rendered by
`router-view`. Should be an object with the same keys as `components` or a
boolean to be applied to every component.

path.name: path
path.description:
Path of the record. Should start with `/` unless the record is the child of
another record.

alias.name: alias
alias.description:
Aliases for the record. Allows defining extra paths that will behave like a
copy of the record. Allows having paths shorthands like `/users/:id` and
`/u/:id`. All `alias` and `path` values must share the same params.

name.name: name
name.description: Name for the route record. Must be unique.

beforeEnter.name: beforeEnter
beforeEnter.description:
Before Enter guard specific to this record. Note `beforeEnter` has no
effect if the record has a `redirect` property.

0.type: (this: undefined, to: RouteLocationNormalizedGeneric, from: RouteLocationNormalizedLoadedGeneric, next: NavigationGuardNext): _Awaitable<...>

meta.name: meta
meta.description: Arbitrary data attached to the record.

validate.name: validate
validate.description:
Validate whether a given route can validly be rendered with this page.

Return true if it is valid, or false if not. If another match can't be found,
this will mean a 404. You can also directly return an object with
statusCode/statusMessage to respond immediately with an error (other matches
will not be checked).

redirect.name: redirect
redirect.description:
Where to redirect if the route is directly matched. The redirection happens
before any navigation guard and triggers a new navigation with the new
target location.

schema.type: string | ((to: RouteLocationGeneric) => string | RouteLocationAsRelativeGeneric | RouteLocationAsPathGeneric) | { name?: RouteRecordNameGeneric; params?: RouteParamsRawGeneric; path?: unknown; query?: LocationQueryRaw; hash?: string; replace?: boolean; force?: boolean; state?: HistoryState; } | { path: string; query?: LocationQueryRaw; hash?: string; replace?: boolean; force?: boolean; state?: HistoryState; }

schema.2: { name?: RouteRecordNameGeneric; params?: RouteParamsRawGeneric; path?: unknown; query?: LocationQueryRaw; hash?: string; replace?: boolean; force?: boolean; state?: HistoryState; }
schema.3: { path: string; query?: LocationQueryRaw; hash?: string; replace?: boolean; force?: boolean; state?: HistoryState; }

alias.name: alias
alias.description:
Aliases for the record. Allows defining extra paths that will behave like a
copy of the record. Allows having paths shorthands like `/users/:id` and
`/u/:id`. All `alias` and `path` values must share the same params.

name.description: You may define a name for this page's route.

path.name: path
path.description: You may define a path matcher, if you have a more complex pattern than can be expressed with the file name.

props.description: Allows accessing the route `params` as props passed to the page component.

scrollToTop.description: Set to `false` to avoid scrolling to top on page navigations

end.name: end
end.description: Should the RegExp match until the end by appending a `$` to it.

strict.name: strict
strict.description: Whether to disallow a trailing slash or not.

path.name: path
path.description:
Path of the record. Should start with `/` unless the record is the child of
another record.

redirect.name: redirect
redirect.description:
Where to redirect if the route is directly matched. The redirection happens
before any navigation guard and triggers a new navigation with the new
target location.

alias.name: alias
alias.description:
Aliases for the record. Allows defining extra paths that will behave like a
copy of the record. Allows having paths shorthands like `/users/:id` and
`/u/:id`. All `alias` and `path` values must share the same params.

name.name: name
name.description: Name for the route record. Must be unique.

beforeEnter.name: beforeEnter
beforeEnter.description:
Before Enter guard specific to this record. Note `beforeEnter` has no
effect if the record has a `redirect` property.

meta.name: meta
meta.description: Arbitrary data attached to the record.

end.name: end
end.description: Should the RegExp match until the end by appending a `$` to it.

strict.name: strict
strict.description: Whether to disallow a trailing slash or not.

redirect.name: redirect
redirect.description:
Where to redirect if the route is directly matched. The redirection happens
before any navigation guard and triggers a new navigation with the new
target location.

props.name: props
props.description: Allow passing down params as props to the component rendered by `router-view`.

another record.

alias.name: alias

Aliases for the record. Allows defining extra paths that will behave like a
copy of the record. Allows having paths shorthands like `/users/:id` and
`/u/:id`. All `alias` and `path` values must share the same params.

meta.name: meta

end.name: end

strict.name: strict
strict.description: Whether to disallow a trailing slash or not.

props.name: props
props.description: {@inheritDoc RouteRecordMultipleViews.props}

enterCallbacks.name: enterCallbacks
enterCallbacks.description: Registered beforeRouteEnter callbacks passed to `next` or returned in guards

instances.name: instances
instances.description:
Mounted route component instances
Having the instances on the record mean beforeRouteUpdate and
beforeRouteLeave guards can only be invoked with the latest mounted app
instance if there are multiple application instances rendering the same
view, basically duplicating the content on the page, which shouldn't happen
in practice. It will work if multiple apps are rendering different named
views.

aliasOf.name: aliasOf
aliasOf.description:
Defines if this record is the alias of another one. This property is
`undefined` if the record is the original one.

fullPath.name: fullPath
fullPath.description:
The whole location including the `search` and `hash`. This string is
percentage encoded.

query.name: query
query.description: Object representation of the `search` property of the current location.

hash.name: hash
hash.description: Hash of the current location. If present, starts with a `#`.

redirectedFrom.name: redirectedFrom
redirectedFrom.description:
Contains the location we were initially trying to access before ending up
on the current location.

matched.name: matched
matched.description:
Array of {@link RouteRecord} containing components as they were
passed when adding records. It can also contain redirect records. This
can't be used directly. **This property is non-enumerable**.

Contains the location we were initially trying to access before ending up
on the current location.

path.description: Percentage encoded pathname section of the URL.

params.name: params

meta.name: meta
meta.description: Merged `meta` properties from all the matched route records.

slots.name: default
slots.type: { Component: VNode<RendererNode, RendererElement, { [key: string]: any; }>; route: RouteLocationNormalizedLoadedGeneric; }

schema.type: { Component: VNode<RendererNode, RendererElement, { [key: string]: any; }>; route: RouteLocationNormalizedLoadedGeneric; }

matched.name: matched
matched.description:
Array of {@link RouteLocationMatched} containing only plain components (any
lazy-loaded components have been loaded and were replaced inside the
`components` object) so it can be directly used to display routes. It
cannot contain redirect records either. **This property is non-enumerable**.

path.name: path
path.description: {@inheritDoc _RouteRecordBase.path}

path.name: path
path.description: A relative path to the current location. This property should be removed

replace.name: replace
replace.description: Replace the entry in the history instead of pushing a new entry

force.name: force
force.description:
Triggers the navigation even if the location is the same as the current one.
Note this will also add a new entry to the history unless `replace: true`
is passed.

state.name: state
state.description:
State to save using the History API. This cannot contain any reactive
values and some primitives like Symbols are forbidden. More info at
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/History/state

path.name: path
path.description: Percentage encoded pathname section of the URL.

replace.name: replace
replace.description: Replace the entry in the history instead of pushing a new entry

force.name: force
force.description:
Triggers the navigation even if the location is the same as the current one.
Note this will also add a new entry to the history unless `replace: true`
is passed.

state.name: state
state.description:
State to save using the History API. This cannot contain any reactive
values and some primitives like Symbols are forbidden. More info at
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/History/state

mods.name: mods
mods.description: Contains the original modules for lazy loaded components.

components.name: components
components.description: Components to display when the URL matches this route. Allow using named views.

redirect.name: redirect
redirect.description:
Where to redirect if the route is directly matched. The redirection happens
before any navigation guard and triggers a new navigation with the new
target location.

props.name: props
props.description:
Allow passing down params as props to the component rendered by
`router-view`. Should be an object with the same keys as `components` or a
boolean to be applied to every component.

path.name: path
path.description:
Path of the record. Should start with `/` unless the record is the child of
another record.

alias.name: alias
alias.description:
Aliases for the record. Allows defining extra paths that will behave like a
copy of the record. Allows having paths shorthands like `/users/:id` and
`/u/:id`. All `alias` and `path` values must share the same params.

name.name: name
name.description: Name for the route record. Must be unique.

beforeEnter.name: beforeEnter
beforeEnter.description:
Before Enter guard specific to this record. Note `beforeEnter` has no
effect if the record has a `redirect` property.

0.type: (this: undefined, to: RouteLocationNormalizedGeneric, from: RouteLocationNormalizedLoadedGeneric, next: NavigationGuardNext): _Awaitable<...>

meta.name: meta
meta.description: Arbitrary data attached to the record.

validate.name: validate
validate.description:
Validate whether a given route can validly be rendered with this page.

Return true if it is valid, or false if not. If another match can't be found,
this will mean a 404. You can also directly return an object with
statusCode/statusMessage to respond immediately with an error (other matches
will not be checked).

redirect.name: redirect
redirect.description:
Where to redirect if the route is directly matched. The redirection happens
before any navigation guard and triggers a new navigation with the new
target location.

name.name: name
name.description: You may define a name for this page's route.

path.name: path
path.description: You may define a path matcher, if you have a more complex pattern than can be expressed with the file name.

props.name: props
props.description: Allows accessing the route `params` as props passed to the page component.

scrollToTop.name: scrollToTop
scrollToTop.description: Set to `false` to avoid scrolling to top on page navigations

end.name: end
end.description: Should the RegExp match until the end by appending a `$` to it.

strict.name: strict
strict.description: Whether to disallow a trailing slash or not.

component.name: component
component.description: Component to display when the URL matches this route.

Available exclusively for `defineNuxtComponent`.
It will not be executed when using `defineComponent`.
